channel.title: Recommended Opinions
channel.description:
I haven't released a server, ever. I've downloaded multiple and multiple amounts of sources/clients and try to learn everything I can from each of them, as I am better at learning-by-doing rather than reading. I usually have the best results using PI, but I certainly don't mind trying a new base. [b]Anyway..[/b] My point is, I would appreciate it if you, well experienced, members would suggest/link me a base/client that they think would have potential to being a decent server. I will be making a Projects thread with the server, and will show each update- etc.
Thanks in advance to anyone who suggests.

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Adobe Adobe
item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:14, topic:525405”][quote author=Adobe link=topic=644150.msg4335287#msg4335287 date=1374253348]

learning to program by reading the code is like trying to learn greek by reading Aristotle’s poetics.

I’m curious of how many more metaphors you could create on this topic.
[/quote]

none since both of those were similes ;)[/quote]

Seventh grade grammar coming back to haunt me, anyway. I’m going to try each of what Vain has suggested, thanks everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Adobe Adobe
item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:8, topic:525405”]go on the wiki and look up the protocol. write a basic framework with java io / nio.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


should learn basics with that.[/quote]
Thanks, I will start this minute.

also. i feel special being in your signature, when that post was over two years ago. :')
You are seriously my idol to Privates Server Programming. I used to "Try hard" help people in the Help section, and when I got stumped, you came from nowhere and knew the situation like you studied it daily. I want to be like you. :|

EDIT: read the new posts. Tutorial, I understand what you are saying completely. Either way, you know I’m going to try.
Vain; Thanks for the suggestions, got plenty to work on now.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Adobe, post:7, topic:525405”][quote author=Fire capez link=topic=644150.msg4335162#msg4335162 date=1374239003]
yep it’s like writing russian without studying the grammar
[/quote]
You’ll eventually pick up on it if you have the determination.

This is going to be exactly what you don’t want to hear, but you will not be able to comprehend most of the protocol unless you understand the language itself. Take this from my past experiences.

I won’t just look at it, see the difficulty level of it, and quit. Whatever I plan on working on I will “Go hard in the paint” to get it finished how desired. I will look through the code repeatedly and study over it, while reading well-written tutorials on what the code means that I am studying. I might just look like I’m ranting on, but if you suggest a base, I will show you my determination and desire of wanting to do this. :D[/quote]if you’re going to just study the code, and read up documentation/tutorials on it. look for graham’s original release of apollo. his design was pretty good, and the code is pretty efficient. if you want to just study the code, study it from a good base.

if you can’t understand apollo, try hyperion. still cant, try runesource. still? give up.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Adobe, post:7, topic:525405”][quote author=Fire capez link=topic=644150.msg4335162#msg4335162 date=1374239003]
yep it’s like writing russian without studying the grammar
[/quote]
You’ll eventually pick up on it if you have the determination.

This is going to be exactly what you don’t want to hear, but you will not be able to comprehend most of the protocol unless you understand the language itself. Take this from my past experiences.

I won’t just look at it, see the difficulty level of it, and quit. Whatever I plan on working on I will “Go hard in the paint” to get it finished how desired. I will look through the code repeatedly and study over it, while reading well-written tutorials on what the code means that I am studying. I might just look like I’m ranting on, but if you suggest a base, I will show you my determination and desire of wanting to do this. :D[/quote]
I can understand that you are willing enough to do this, and I’m sure everyone can see that it’s quite clear you have the determination to do this, but tutorials in regards to RSPS will get you no where when it comes to understanding the actual code.

For example:
While a RS2 emulator might have polymorphism, you will have to actually know the language associated with it to understand what variables and such contribute to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you learn more by trying, rather than reading?

go on the wiki and look up the protocol. write a basic framework with java io / nio.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


should learn basics with that.

keep trying different design techniques.

also. i feel special being in your signature, when that post was over two years ago. :’)

Read full topic

item.title: Recommended Opinions
item.dc:creator: @Adobe Adobe
item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

Fire capez:

yep it’s like writing russian without studying the grammar

You’ll eventually pick up on it if you have the determination.

Tutorial:

This is going to be exactly what you don’t want to hear, but you will not be able to comprehend most of the protocol unless you understand the language itself. Take this from my past experiences.

I won’t just look at it, see the difficulty level of it, and quit. Whatever I plan on working on I will “Go hard in the paint” to get it finished how desired. I will look through the code repeatedly and study over it, while reading well-written tutorials on what the code means that I am studying. I might just look like I’m ranting on, but if you suggest a base, I will show you my determination and desire of wanting to do this.

Read full topic
